actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with 40 minutes of debate on the motion to suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 452.
Mr. Williams (TX) moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5100.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 5100 â€” "To extend the SBIR and STTR programs, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 276h, clause 10 of rule I, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Mexico-United States Interparliamentary Group: Mr. Cuellar, Mr. Correa, Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas, Ms. Escobar and Mr. Carbajal.

actions-list.header: United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 1928a, and the order of the House of January 3, 2025, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly: Mr. Boyle of Pennsylvania.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Stephanie I. Bice to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
